issue.title: Can't highlight unencrypted text to copy etc.
Allow for the ability to generate PGP keypairs
issue.body: OpenPGP.js allows for this, it just needs to be integrated into the extension's popup.

issue.title: Clean up on-boarding process
issue.body: A user should be able to easily and seamlessly upload or generate their private key. Feedback should be shown along the way.

issue.title: Add hints and annotations to the UI
issue.body: It would be nice to display annotations under messages that are being verified, and brief toasts when decryption/encryption is taking place. Materialize would make this fairly straight forward.

issue.title: Add hints and annotations to the UI

issue.title: Change Bower installation directory
issue.body: Install the Bower packages directly inside the extension directory as opposed to in a separate one.

issue.title: Add listener for tab or window regaining focus
issue.body: If the messenger.com tab does not have focus when a message comes in, it doesn't auto decrpyt when you return to the tab. Sending a message of any sort or refreshing the page causes it to decrypt immediately.

issue.title: Can't highlight unencrypted text to copy etc.
Add hints and annotations to the UI
issue.body: It would be nice to display annotations under messages that are being verified, and brief toasts when decryption/encryption is taking place. Materialize would make this fairly straight forward.

issue.title: Clean up on-boarding process
issue.body: A user should be able to easily and seamlessly upload or generate their private key. Feedback should be shown along the way.

issue.title: Group message support
issue.body: This should be fairly trivial to add, and would only be enabled if all parties have a public key available.

issue.title: Prompt user for private key password, instead of storing it in chrome.storage.local
issue.body:
Storing the password in Chrome's storage was a hack just to get the POC working. The password should only be cached for the lifetime of the page.

Optionally, the user could choose to save the password in Chrome's storage, however it will be strongly recommended not to.
